item.title: We raised a bunch of money
item.description: - The company Fly.io recently raised a significant amount of money from investors, including A16Z, Intel Capital, and Dell.

item.title: Fast machines, slow machines
item.description: - The author conducted a comparison between an old computer running Windows NT 3.51 and a new computer running Windows 11, showing that the old computer had significantly faster app loading times.

item.title: Plastics are poisoning us
item.description: - Plastics are causing serious pollution and health risks due to their widespread use and improper disposal.

item.title: Type-safe, K-sortable, globally unique identifier inspired by Stripe IDs
item.description: - TypeIDs are a type-safe, K-sortable, globally unique identifier inspired by Stripe IDs.

item.title: Show HN: Open-source background removal in the browser
item.description: - '@imgly/background-removal' is an open-source npm package that allows developers to remove backgrounds from images directly in the browser, without the need for additional server costs.

item.title: National Geographic lays off its last remaining staff writers
item.description: - National Geographic magazine has laid off all of its remaining staff writers, marking another cutback in a series of layoffs under owner Walt Disney Co.

item.title: Canada plans brain drain of H-1B visa holders, with no-job, no-worries permits
item.description: - Canada is offering tech professionals with H-1B visas in the USA the opportunity to move to Canada without a job waiting for them.

item.title: The damaging results of mandated return to office
item.description: - The mandated return to the office has resulted in higher attrition rates and recruitment struggles for companies.

item.title: Apple joins opposition to encrypted message app scanning
item.description: - Apple has joined a growing opposition to powers in the Online Safety Bill that would require encrypted messaging apps like iMessage and WhatsApp to scan messages for child abuse material.

item.title: US Congress doubles down on claims of illegal UFO retrieval programs
item.description: - Senate Intelligence Committee Vice Chairman Marco Rubio has stated that individuals with high clearances and positions in the US government have come forward with first-hand claims of UFO-related activities beyond what the committee has dealt with before.
